Antigua and Barbuda.area: 443 sq km (Antigua 280 sq km; Barbuda 161 sq km)

Argentina.highest point: Cerro Aconcagua (located in the northwestern corner of the province of Mendoza; highest point in South America) 6,962 m

Azerbaijan.coastline long: 0 km (landlocked); note - Azerbaijan borders the Caspian Sea (713 km)

Bahamas, The.highest point: 1.3 km NE of Old Bight on Cat Island 64 m

Benin.highest point: unnamed elevation 675 m; located 2.5 km southeast of the town of Kotopounga

Burundi.highest point: unnamed elevation on Mukike Range 2,685 m

Cabo Verde.highest point: Mt. Fogo (a volcano on Fogo Island) 2,829 m

Chile.highest point: Nevado Ojos del Salado 6,893 m (highest volcano in the world)

China.highest point: Mount Everest (highest peak in Asia and highest point on earth above sea level) 8,849 m

Colombia.coastline long: 3,208 km (Caribbean Sea 1,760 km, North Pacific Ocean 1,448 km)

Congo, Democratic Republic of the.highest point: Pic Marguerite on Mont Ngaliema (Mount Stanley) 5,110 m

Cyprus.area: 9,251 sq km (of which 3,355 sq km are in north Cyprus)

Eritrea.coastline long: 2,234 km (mainland on Red Sea 1,151 km, islands in Red Sea 1,083 km)

Gambia, The.highest point: unnamed elevation 63 m; 3 km southeast of the town of Sabi

Guatemala.highest point: Volcan Tajumulco (highest point in Central America) 4,220 m

Guyana.highest point: Laberintos del Norte on Mount Roraima 2,775 m

Honduras.coastline long: 823 km (Caribbean Sea 669 km, Gulf of Fonseca 163 km)

Iran.coastline long: 2,440 km - note: Iran also borders the Caspian Sea (740 km)

Israel.population: 9,043,387 (2023 est.) (includes populations of the Golan Heights or Golan Sub-District and also East Jerusalem, which was annexed by Israel after 1967)
Israel.highest point: Mitspe Shlagim 2,224 m; note - this is the highest named point, the actual highest point is an unnamed dome slightly to the west of Mitspe Shlagim at 2,236 m; both points are on the northeastern border of Israel, along the southern end of the Anti-Lebanon mountain range

Italy.highest point: Mont Blanc (Monte Bianco) de Courmayeur (a secondary peak of Mont Blanc) 4,748 m

Kazakhstan.coastline long: 0 km (landlocked); note - Kazakhstan borders the Aral Sea, now split into two bodies of water (1,070 km), and the Caspian Sea (1,894 km)
Kazakhstan.highest point: Pik Khan-Tengri 7,010 mnote - the northern most 7,000 meter peak in the World

Kuwait.highest point: 3.6 km W. of Al-Salmi Border Post 300 m

Malaysia.coastline long: 4,675 km (Peninsular Malaysia 2,068 km, East Malaysia 2,607 km)

Maldives.highest point: 8th tee, golf course, Villingi Island 5 m

Malta.coastline long: 196.8 km (excludes 56 km for the island of Gozo)

Nepal.highest point: Mount Everest (highest peak in Asia and highest point on earth above sea level) 8,849 m

Netherlands.highest point: Mount Scenery (on the island of Saba in the Caribbean, now considered an integral part of the Netherlands following the dissolution of the Netherlands Antilles) 862 m

New Zealand.highest point: Aoraki/Mount Cook 3,724 m; note - the mountain's height was 3,764 m until 14 December 1991 when it lost about 10 m in an avalanche of rock and ice; erosion of the ice cap since then has brought the height down another 30 m

Norway.coastline long: 25,148 km (includes mainland 2,650 km, as well as long fjords, numerous small islands, and minor indentations 22,498 km; length of island coastlines 58,133 km)

Portugal.highest point: Ponta do Pico (Pico or Pico Alto) on Ilha do Pico in the Azores 2,351 m

Russia.highest point: Gora El'brus (highest point in Europe) 5,642 m

Saint Kitts and Nevis.area: 261 sq km (Saint Kitts 168 sq km; Nevis 93 sq km)

Senegal.highest point: unnamed elevation 2.8 km southeast of Nepen Diaka 648 m

Spain.highest point: Pico de Teide (Tenerife) on Canary Islands 3,718 m

Tonga.highest point: Kao Volcano on Kao Island 1,046 m

Turkmenistan.coastline long: 0 km (landlocked); note - Turkmenistan borders the Caspian Sea (1,768 km)

Uganda.highest point: Margherita Peak on Mount Stanley 5,110 m

United States.highest point: Denali 6,190 m (Mount McKinley) (highest point in North America)

Uzbekistan.coastline long: 0 km (doubly landlocked); note - Uzbekistan includes the southern portion of the Aral Sea with a 420 km shoreline
